title: Iran in collective shock after bloody crackdown
subhead: Even though internet access remains mostly cut off, a few openings have allowed the population to grasp the unprecedented violence unleashed on protesters: tens of thousands killed, mass arrests, hospitals under surveillance and overcrowded prisons.

title: Former French senator found guilty of drugging MP with intent to sexually assault or rape
Capgemini in turmoil over its work with ICE
Trump says he will 'de-escalate' in Minneapolis after shooting backlash
subhead: Donald Trump told reporters on Tuesday that he wants 'a very honorable and honest investigation' into the killing of Alex Pretti, 37, who was shot by immigration agents on Saturday. Trump's senior aide Stephen Miller, days after falsely branding the victim an assassin, said US immigration agents may have breached 'protocol.'

title: How India and the EU created a common market to counter Trump
subhead: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and representatives of the European Union concluded a trade agreement on January 27, after nearly 20 years of intermittent negotiations, opening up a market of nearly two billion people.

title: Paris's Musée Marmottan Monet explores the mysterious state of sleep
subhead: Thanks to exceptional loans, an innovative and thought-provoking exhibition at the museum explores how slumber has inspired painters.

title: Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhead: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.

title: Le Pen's appeal trial: Far-right ex-assistants struggle to justify their jobs

2026 FIFA World Cup: Calls for boycott emerge to bring Trump 'to his senses'
Richard Ford: 'I tell my European friends how it feels not to understand my country'
subhead: The novelist expresses concern, in an op-ed for Le Monde, about the direction his country has taken under President Donald Trump. He laments that Americans do not appear to pay attention to the erosion of their constitutional rights, nor do they grasp how difficult it will be to turn back.

title: France's Assemblée Nationale approves social media ban for under-15s
subhead: The legislation also bans the use of mobile phones by students in high schools. Backed by the government, the bill put forward by MP Laure Miller will benefit from a fast-track procedure, announced by President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Eiffel Tower to honor 72 women scientists for posterity
subhead: On Monday, a multidisciplinary commission presented the mayor of Paris with a list of 72 names of women who will join the exclusively male scientists whose names are inscribed on the frieze of the 'Iron Lady.'
